Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Ceramic materials for the built environment: Tiles, Bricks, Concrete and Whiteware

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, This is a reminder that the online exam is available for you to take this week, until Friday at 14:00. You will have one attempt of 1 hour to take this exam. Please contact me if you have any problems, challenges or queries. Kindest regards, and best of luck Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students. Please remember that on Wednesday and thursday this week we will have our presentation sessions. Please see the table below for the list of presenters.  The online exam will be made available next week.  Tomorrow (Tuesday) we do not have a session.  Looking forward to seeing you all at both sessions! Please be there to support your fellow students and to engage with the content by asking questions.

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, Please make sure you have selected your preferred presentation timeslot for 2,3 or 4 of July.  I hope you have had a rewarding learning experience in this course. Please take a few minutes to complete the evaluation survey at the link below: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=S94RP If you have any specific feedback about this learning unit, please send to me by email at dorian.hanaor@tu-berlin.de I look forward to hearing your presentations. The online exam will be available to take during the week  of 8-12 of July. My apologies for the confusion in this regard. Kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will meet tomorrow for our final tutorial session where we will look at tiles, toilets and the degradation of ceramics in the built environment. Regarding the presentations, we will do this on 4 July. If there are some difficulties with this date, we can also have this session on 3 July. The exam will be online and will take place the following week. It will be available online during the period 8-12 July If there are any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. Kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We meet again tomorrow to examine the topic of glass.  I look forward to seeing you there  Best regards,  Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will look tomorrow a bit more closely at Cement chemistry and its role in facilitating the performance of concrete.  Please come prepared with any questions you may have to discuss and have a look at this week's tutorial questions. https://isis.tu-berlin.de/pluginfile.php/3189867/mod_forum/post/1075156/Session%205%20tutorial%20%20-%20Ceramic%20materials%20for%20the%20built%20environment.pdf Looking forward to seeing you all tomorrow. Kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will meet tomorrow to discuss cement and concrete. Please have a look at the ISIS content and come prepared with any questions you may have regarding the content of this topic. Kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will have another session tomorrow at the usual time of 12:00 Please have a look at the tutorial questions beforehand.   I apologise for the duplication of content here in ISIS, unfortunatley TU Belrin do not have a solution for this.

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, Just a kind reminder that we meet tomorrow at 12:15 to discuss clay and its role in the built environment. Please come prepared with some thoughts, musings and inspiration concerning clay and reflect on its role in the built environment. Please also have a look at the tutorial questions, which are on the isis page. On another note, the course/exam is now open for enrolment via Moses. Please make sure you are enrolled  Thanks  Dorian

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Session 2 on -8 May (wed instead of thurs)

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, Our next session will be on the topic of clay. As next Thursday is also a public holiday, we will have this session on Wednesday 8th of May at  12:15-14:00. I apologize for any confusion.  Clay is an interesting material that form the basis for a wide range of materials and applications in the built environment.  Please have a look in advance at the self-access content and the  tutorial questions for this session, and try to identify some interesting materials in your own built environment. We will have a discussion in the session on the properties, processing and raw materials used to produce clay based construction elements. Tut 2.pdf  Looking forward to seeing you all there  Best wishes Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will postpone this week's session to next week, as many students are using the May day holiday to make an extra-long weekend. We meet  We will meet on Thursday 09.05.2024 at 12:00 to further explore the theme of clay and brickmaking.  Looking forward to seeing you all again  Best wishes,  Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will have our first session tomorrow at 12-14:00  In BA3 Please familiarise yourself with the content of the first topic in ISIS, Read the notes and watch the video. Read and prepare answers for the tutorial questions. It would be really great if you could come prepared with some materials or applications from the built environment that you are familiar with, and we can discuss these together in our multi-disciplinary forum. Looking forward to meeting you all tomorrow!! Best wishes, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, It brings me great pleasure to welcome you to the module Ceramic Materials for the Built Environment We will have in total 8 face-to-face tutorial/discussion sessions Our first session will take place next week, on Thursday 25.04.2024 at 12:00-14:00 at BA3 room 316. These sessions will be intended for tutorial / interdisciplinary exchanges.  The learning content is available via-self access here on ISIS Please excuse the duplication of content on ISIS - the site is very messy at the moment with each piece of content being repeated numerous times. I am slowly trying to tidy this up. Please make sure you have filled out your information in the survey titled "SoSe 2024 Bitte Sofort Nach Eintragen in den Kurs Ausfullen" I look forward to welcoming you all to the course. Please contact me with any question you might have Best regards Dorian Hanaor
